reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Managing integrated TB/HIV response in Papua New Guinea

description.narrative: Papua New Guinea - TB/HIV - World Vision (PNG) Trust - WV Papua New Guinea. This program has the following goals: Estimated TB prevalence rate reduced from the current level of 541 per 100,000 population in 2012 to 339 per 100,000 population by 2020. Estimated TB mortality rate reduced from 54 per 100,000 population per year in 2012 to 30 per 100,000 population per year by 2020. A successful response to STIs and HIV that is driven by accurate and up-to-date strategic information and research. Decreased STI and HIV transmission and improved health and well-being of PLHIV. An environment that is safe and supportive of people’s efforts to remain healthy. An efficiently managed, capable and well-resourced national, provincial and district response to STIs and HIV. The objectives of this program are: Strengthen the implementation of local/PNG TB care and prevention strategy to increase (a) the case notification rate for bacteriologically- confirmed, new and relapse cases, from 43 in 2013 to 93 per 100,000 population in 2020 and (b) the treatment success rate of bacteriologically - confirmed new TB cases from 68 percent in 2012 to 88% in 2020. Improve the programmatic management of drug resistant TB in all the provinces focusing on high prevalent provinces: Western, NCD, Morobe, and Madang by increasing (a) the percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving drug susceptibility testing (DST) from 16 percent in 2013 to 96 percent in 2020 and (b) the treatment success rate for MDR-TB from 14 percent in 2011 to 60 percent in 2020. Increase the coverage of HIV testing of TB patients from <25 percent in 2013 to >90 percent in 2020 in all provinces, focusing on 10 high HIV burden provinces, by strengthening the HIV/TB collaborative activities. 70% of PLHIV know their status by 2020. 70% of PLHIV are accessing antiretroviral therapy by 2020. 90% of PLHIV on ART have a suppressed viral load within 12 months of commencing ART by 2020. Contribute in ensuring uninterrupted supply of drugs and medical products for Malaria,TB and HIV programmes through effective operationalization of mSupply, a Logistics Management Information System (LMIS), among existing and expansion sites in 2017 and 2020 respectively.
